conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction to find the induced EMF in a rotating coil.
The formula for induced EMF is given by: \( \mathcal{E} = n \cdot B \cdot A \cdot \omega \cdot \sin(\omega t) \).
Explanation of variables: \( n \) is the number of turns, \( B \) is the magnetic induction intensity, \( A \) is the area, \( \omega \) is the angular velocity, \( t \) is time.
Timing starts when the coil is in the neutral plane, at \( t = 0 \), \( \sin(\omega t) = 0 \).
Maximum induced EMF occurs when \( \sin(\omega t) = 1 \).
Calculate the area \( A \) of the coil: \( A = l_{AB} \times l_{BC} = 0.2\, \text{m} \times 0.5\, \text{m} = 0.1\, \text{m}^2 \).
Substitute values into the formula for maximum induced EMF: \( \mathcal{E}_{\text{max}} = n \cdot B \cdot A \cdot \omega \).
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force in the coil is approximately \( 314.16\, \text{V} \).
